According to a if this situation will continue, the petrol will in 2050. Moreover, it is widely said that the will increase. This will make the amount of natural .On the other hand, there are some individuals who disagree with above-mentioned perception. The natural resources will technology. For example, the of technology such as cars a positive impact the society. By using this, we can the consumption of natural resources. Eventually, we will not need natural fuel. In my opinion, of natural is , I think the loss of it a negative impact the society because won’t have a comfortable life any more.In conclusion, I agree with the idea that there is no longer enough natural resources to sustain this situation. In order to our life, the governments countries should tackle this issue.
llm: Recently, natural resources have significantly decreased around the world due to population growth. Some individuals argue that we still have sufficient resources. However, there are others who challenge this viewpoint. This essay will explore the underlying issues of this situation.On one hand, some believe that if the current trend continues, our quality of life will suffer because natural resources are finite. For instance, it is projected that oil supplies may be depleted by 2050 if consumption patterns persist. Furthermore, it is widely acknowledged that population growth will accelerate the depletion of these resources.On the other hand, some individuals disagree with the aforementioned perspective. They argue that advancements in technology will help us manage natural resources more efficiently. For example, innovations in technology, like electric vehicles, can have a positive impact on society. By adopting such technologies, we can reduce our reliance on fossil fuels, potentially diminishing the need for non-renewable resources altogether.In my opinion, the depletion of natural resources is indeed concerning, and I believe that its loss could negatively affect society, as it may lead to a decline in our standard of living.In conclusion, I agree with the notion that there may no longer be enough natural resources to sustain our current trajectory. To improve our quality of life, governments worldwide must address this pressing issue.

question: These days, many young people are not spending their weekends and holidays doing outdoor activities such as hiking or mountaineering. Why is that happening? How can they be encouraged to spend more time in the natural environment?
human: Nowadays, the younger generation tends to avoid recreational activities such as hiking or alpinism. It seems that young people prefer to spend their weekends indoors, gaming or engaging in other online activities. If that is the case, by promoting sports more actively and organising sports competitions, the schools could counteract this trend.Living in the era of technology, the wide availability and variety of online entertainment are compelling young people to spend a lot of their free time indoors, using their gadgets. Numerous relatively cheap forms of amusement, such as online games, videos, audiobooks and plenty of other activities, tempt teenagers to stay at home and lead more sedentary lifestyles. A recent survey revealed that the vast majority of students would prefer spending their weekends playing computer games, rather than in the nature. That is one clear reason why our modern youth is less interested in recreational sports.To address this issue, the school management could intervene and offer a better range of outdoor sports activities and competitions, both within the school curriculum and as extra-curricular activities. For example, high schools could increase the number of weekly football, running and climbing classes, and organise competitions at the end of each term. As a result, pushed by their desire to win, students would do more walking, jogging, running and mountaineering during the school term, in preparation for the competition. This would reduce the time spent online, lessen the students’ dependence on the Internet for entertainment, and eventually boost their desire to spend more time enjoying the natural environment.To sum up, screen addiction plays a major role in young people’s avoidance of various outdoor activities. Opening up more recreational sports and offering frequent competitions on school grounds is a great way to motivate more students to spend their leisure time in the nature.
llm: Today, the younger generation appears to be steering away from outdoor recreational activities like hiking and climbing. Instead, many young people opt to spend their weekends indoors, engrossed in gaming or other online pursuits. To combat this trend, schools could play a significant role by actively promoting sports and organizing competitions.In our technology-driven age, the abundance of online entertainment increasingly traps young individuals indoors, glued to their devices. Affordable options for entertainment, such as video games, streaming content, and audiobooks, lure teenagers to stay home and adopt more sedentary lifestyles. Recent surveys indicate that most students would rather spend their weekends gaming than exploring nature, highlighting a key reason for the decline in interest in recreational sports among today’s youth.To tackle this concern, school administrations could enhance the variety of outdoor sports activities and competitions available to students, both within the school curriculum and as extracurricular options. For instance, high schools could increase the frequency of football, running, and climbing classes, culminating in competitive events at the end of each term. This competitive spirit could encourage students to engage in more physical activities like walking, jogging, running, and climbing in preparation for these competitions. Ultimately, this could lead to decreased screen time and a reduced reliance on the internet for entertainment, fostering a greater appreciation for the outdoors.In conclusion, screen addiction significantly contributes to the younger generation's tendency to avoid outdoor activities. By introducing more recreational sports and regular competitions on school grounds, we can inspire students to embrace spending their leisure time in nature.

question: To be labelled a ‘Work of Art’, a painting, sculpture or other art form should display certain qualities that are unique. However, over the past century there has been a decline in the quality of prize-winning artwork and it is now possible for quite ordinary pieces of art to be labelled ‘masterpieces ’ whilst true works of art pass unnoticed.Do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: For centuries, artworks have been titled  'Work of Art' based on their extraordinary qualities. However, some people argue that nowadays, the standards are decreasing and the labelling of substandard artworks as 'masterpieces' has become ubiquitous. The upcoming essay will discuss why I agree that original paintings are being neglected while usual ones are being praised.Firstly, the superficial nature of humans is responsible for this change. These days, people do not see the meaning behind the painting or the message the artist is trying to convey rather they buy those paintings which are popular and contemporary. To illustrate it further, in art auctions it can be seen that when one person bids on one painting, no matter whether it is good or bad, others also start putting their money on it. Thus it is clear that normal art forms are winning prizes due to public attention.Secondly, some artists might bribe the organizers of exhibitions to promote their canvas. Indeed, there have been some recorded instances when artists were caught while signing up deals to increase the sales of their work. If a certain artwork receives publicity then it is impossible that it would not have an influence on the public. This type of promotion skews a person's opinion about a certain picture and so are forced to think about purchasing it, leaving behind original ones. Therefore, it is apparent that the diabolical activities of painters are responsible for their works being labelled as masterpieces.To conclude, the maintenance of social position and influence of painters are the prime causes for the popularity of ordinary artworks and the negligence of true works. Hence I agree with the given statement.
llm: For centuries, extraordinary artworks have been referred to as 'Works of Art.' However, there is a growing sentiment that contemporary standards are declining, with subpar pieces often being labeled as 'masterpieces.' In this essay, I will explain why I believe that genuine works are being overlooked in favor of more conventional ones.Firstly, the superficial tendencies of society contribute significantly to this shift. Today, many people prioritize trendy and popular artworks over the deeper meanings or messages behind them. For instance, during art auctions, it's common to witness a bandwagon effect; when one individual places a bid on a painting, regardless of its quality, others are quick to follow suit. This behavior highlights how mainstream appeal often dictates which artworks are celebrated, overshadowing more original creations.Secondly, there are instances where artists may resort to unethical practices, such as bribing exhibition organizers to promote their work. There have been documented cases of artists being caught in schemes aimed at boosting sales through undue influence. If an artwork gains significant publicity, it naturally impacts public perception, leading individuals to consider purchasing it rather than exploring more authentic pieces. Consequently, such manipulative tactics further blur the line between true artistry and commercial hype.In conclusion, the quest for social standing and the influence of certain artists are primary drivers behind the elevation of mediocre art at the expense of genuine masterpieces. Thus, I align with the assertion that true artistic works are being unjustly neglected.

question: Today children are spending much more time watching TV compared to the past. Why do you think this happens? Is this a positive or a negative change?
human: A trend has emerged in the last two decades with youngsters watching more TV than ever before. One of the main reasons behind this issue is the recent advancements in technology in gaming and film industries. This tendency has both pros and cons, and will be further discussed in this essay.The latest developments in video game consoles attracted both children and adults to spend extra time watching TV, compared to the past. With interactive gaming characters and high quality graphics, children are more likely to spend long hours playing games in front of the TV. A recent survey showed that TV addiction among young people, for example, has significantly increased from 5% to 80%, which was supposedly caused by the introduction of advanced gaming consoles. This increase is also partially due to films, drama series and cartoons being easily available on pirated websites and various gaming platforms.This trend has had more negative than positive effects on young citizens. More time spent watching TV adversely affects the mental and physical wellbeing of a child. For instance, the obesity ratio among young individuals in the past 10 years has risen dramatically; this has caused further health problems such as anxiety and depression. However, TV can also be used in a positive way. It is a great source of information that can help youngsters increase their knowledge and succeed in their future careers.In conclusion, recent breakthroughs in technology are driving up the amount of time our youngsters are spending in front of their TV screens. This can do more harm than good if we don’t regulate the use of TV, but parents have the power to make TV time useful and beneficial for their children.
llm: In the past two decades, a notable trend has emerged: young people are watching more television than ever before. A key factor contributing to this phenomenon is the significant advancements in technology within the gaming and film industries. This trend presents both advantages and disadvantages, which will be explored further in this essay. The latest developments in video game consoles have led both children and adults to devote more time to television than in previous years. With the arrival of interactive gaming characters and high-quality graphics, children are increasingly inclined to spend extended periods playing games in front of the TV. A recent survey indicates that TV addiction among young people has soared from 5% to 80%, purportedly due to the introduction of sophisticated gaming consoles. This surge can also be attributed to the widespread availability of films, dramas, and cartoons on pirated websites and various gaming platforms.Overall, the implications of this trend are largely negative for young individuals. Increased screen time can harm both their mental and physical health. For example, the obesity rate among youth has risen dramatically over the past decade, leading to additional health issues such as anxiety and depression. Nevertheless, television can also serve a positive purpose. It offers a valuable source of information that can help youth expand their knowledge and excel in their future careers.In conclusion, recent technological advancements are significantly increasing the amount of time young people are spending in front of screens. If not monitored, this trend may yield more detrimental effects than benefits. However, parents have the ability to ensure that TV viewing is both productive and advantageous for their children.

question: Today family members do not eat meals together. Why does this happen? Is this a positive or negative developmentGive reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: Dinner tables are no longer a place for family reunion in today's society. Reasons from many aspects account for this phenomenon which pose a huge threat to the happiness of family and the harmony of society.Causes vary from person to person. Some people, especially the young believing that conflicts are common on dinner tables, tend to have meals with their friends rather than their family members. But most people are deprived of their rights by the development of society. Too busy to get home at dinner time, people have to eat meals near workplace. Also, with the job diversity increasing, rarely can family members with different timetables eat meals at the same period. For instance, a bank agent getting home at 6 pm tends to miss her doctor husband leaving home at 5 pm for emergency work.It is the advantages of sharing meals with family that attach great importance to this event. Time for communication is so critical that families lacking such opportunities are often full of misunderstandings and quarrels. Not only can this development increase the divorce rate but it may also decrease the marriage rate. Because support and care from family, the previous harbor, is deprived and people see no significance from getting married. With such phenomenon prevailing, the negative emotions may take advantage in the society. Loneliness, distress and helplessness stike those always eating alone.In a nutshell, taking the damage to both families and societies into consideration, various solutions should be put forward to the roots behind the situation.
llm: Dinner tables have lost their role as a gathering place for families in today’s society. Several factors contribute to this trend, which poses a significant threat to family happiness and societal harmony. The reasons vary among individuals. Many, particularly younger people, believe that conflicts are common during family meals and therefore prefer dining with friends instead. Additionally, societal advancements often leave people with little time to gather with family for dinner. With busy schedules, many are forced to eat near their workplaces. Furthermore, as job diversity increases, it becomes increasingly rare for family members with differing schedules to eat together. For example, a bank employee who returns home at 6 PM might miss her doctor spouse, who leaves for emergency work at 5 PM.Sharing meals with family holds tremendous importance, as it provides essential opportunities for communication. Families that lack such interactions often experience misunderstandings and conflicts. This disconnect can lead to higher divorce rates and lower marriage rates, as individuals feel deprived of the support and care that family should provide, leading them to question the value of marriage. As this trend continues, negative emotions such as loneliness, distress, and helplessness may spread through society, affecting those who regularly dine alone.In conclusion, to address the damage inflicted on both families and society, it is crucial to explore various solutions that tackle the root causes of this issue.

question: Today, the high sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which they are sold. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: There is no doubt that nowadays advertising plays a very strong role in saling goods. The high rate of sales does not always mean the real needs of some goods. In this essay, i will discuss both views and draw my personal conclusion.In terms of advertising's power in increasing sales of popular consumer goods, advertising has an essencial role these days in sales. The main reason given to support this claim is advertisnig attracts people and inform people about the new and special products in a very special way. To illustrate, using social media for marketing and advertising raise sales dramatecly. People spend most of their times to watch what is in the social media and that means social media is the best way to do your marketing.However, some people say that people buy these products not because they really need them but because they like the way that was used to advertise these products. On the other hand, some times people purchase goods because they have seen them or heard about them from others or from the social media not due to their needs of these products.In conclusion, I believe that increasing the sales of some popular consumer goods show how strong is advertising and how advertising plays a crucial role in saling products. Also, smart business owners should think about advertising as a fast way to sale their goods. As was previously menthond, people can be attracted by all kinds of advertising and that definitly lead to increasing the sale rate.
llm: It is undeniable that advertising plays a significant role in selling products today. A high volume of sales does not necessarily reflect the genuine needs for certain goods. In this essay, I will explore both perspectives and provide my own conclusion.When it comes to the influence of advertising on the sales of popular consumer goods, its impact is undeniable. Advertising captivates and informs consumers about new and unique products in compelling ways. For example, leveraging social media for marketing can dramatically boost sales, as people spend a considerable amount of time engaging with content online. This makes social media an ideal platform for advertising.Conversely, some argue that consumers buy products not out of necessity, but rather because they are drawn to how those products are advertised. In some cases, people may purchase items simply because they have seen them promoted or heard about them through social media, rather than due to an actual need for those products.In conclusion, I believe that the surge in sales of certain popular consumer goods underscores the effectiveness of advertising and its crucial role in driving product sales. Furthermore, savvy business owners should recognize advertising as a powerful tool for selling their products. As previously mentioned, various advertising methods can captivate consumers, ultimately leading to increased sales.

question: Today’s young generation is facing many problems at school and at home. What are the problems? What can parents do to help their teenage children?
human: Young people today are under a lot of pressure, which seems to come from many directions. The problems they are experiencing happen not only at school, but also at home, and it seems that without adult guidance, our young generation will continue to struggle.Teenage years have never been simple, and many would agree that the amount of challenges has only increased with the passage of time. Bullying has been a problem for quite a while, and children and adolescents would have experienced it at school in the past, but then it would stop at home. At present, however, things have been made worse by social media penetrating the supposedly safe space of our teenagers. The unfortunate behaviour of their peers can now reach them even in their bedrooms, causing them constant distress.Another issue troubling many young people is the pressure to succeed by their families. Whether at school or at home, they often feel as if they are not smart enough, which creates overwhelm and despair. Understandably, their parents are pursuing a worthy goal of ensuring their children get a great start in life; however, many teens feel that they are failing their families when they don’t live up to their expectations. This often leads to dishonest and unethical behaviour, such as cheating on tests or plagiarising other students’ work. When uncovered, these incidents have a profound effect on young people’s future careers, not to mention their emotional well-being.It is hard to underestimate the importance of parental support to navigating life as a young person. From helping teens build a positive body image and self-esteem, to handling classmates’ difficult behaviour, to guidance where study is concerned, parents can make a world of difference. Talking to their sons and daughters about matters that worry them, listening and making non-judgmental suggestions are great ways to help. Getting a professional involved where necessary and engaging with teachers, councilors and coaches is another opportunity for parents to provide assistance. Last but not least, parents can make their children better and happier people by simply giving them unconditional love.To sum up, being a young person in the modern world isn’t easy. By banding together and paying careful attention to their teens, families can help them overcome any obstacles to becoming successful adults.
llm: Today's youth face significant pressures from various sources. The challenges they encounter are not limited to school; they also extend into their home lives, and without adequate adult guidance, the struggles of this generation are likely to persist. Adolescence has always been a tumultuous time, but many believe that the difficulties have intensified over the years. Bullying, a longstanding issue, used to be confined to the school environment, but now, with the rise of social media, it infiltrates what should be the safe haven of home. The negative actions of peers can reach teenagers in the sanctity of their own bedrooms, leading to ongoing distress.Another concern for many young people is the pressure to succeed imposed by their families. Whether at school or in the home, they often grapple with feelings of inadequacy, leading to overwhelm and despair. While parents have the noble intention of ensuring their children start life on the right foot, many teens often feel they are letting their families down if they cannot meet those expectations. This pressure can sometimes drive them to engage in dishonest and unethical behavior, such as cheating on exams or plagiarizing classmates' work. When such actions are discovered, they can have serious repercussions on young people’s future prospects and emotional health.The role of parental support in helping young people navigate life is crucial. Parents can make a significant difference by assisting teens with building a positive body image and self-esteem, managing difficult interactions with peers, and providing academic guidance. Open discussions about concerns, active listening, and offering non-judgmental advice are effective ways for parents to help. Additionally, involving professionals, such as teachers, counselors, and coaches, can provide further assistance. Most importantly, offering unconditional love can enable children to develop into better, happier individuals.In summary, being a young person in today’s world is challenging. By coming together and paying close attention to their adolescents, families can help them overcome obstacles and pave the way for their success as adults.

question: Tourism today creates a variety of problems, such as pollution due to flights, transport and dirty water.Do you think that governments should impose extra taxes on flights or accommodation to restrict today’s tourism industry?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: Travelling today is simple to the extent that within twelve hours one can travel from Europe to Singapore, crossing nearly the whole globe. Based on this simplicity, tourism has changed significantly over the years. While in the past a family would be proud to drive two hours to a lake, many families now think nothing of travelling to the far side of the world. This also has a downside as increased pollution is a result. Extra taxes on flights or accommodation have therefore been offered as a solution so as to increase the cost of tourism and reduce its popularity.No matter what major transportation is used, travelling creates pollution. To decrease the amount of pollution caused by tourism, the tourism industry itself would have to be weakened. If these increased taxes are based on travelling distance, people would be more willing to stay closer to their home country, as for many even a slight increase would mean that their planned holidays would be too expensive. Accommodation taxes would raise holiday costs no matter the distance travelled. Therefore, if increased taxes were levied on travel and accommodation, tourism and therefore pollution would decrease.On the other hand, the main transport methods that would be impacted by imposing extra taxes would be communal ones, such as planes, trains and buses, and increasing the taxes would also impact non-tourists. Also, holidays are a vital part of ordinary people’s lives, as they escape from work and stress, and get to spend valuable time with their families. Stopping people travelling would greatly impact some simple pleasures of ordinary life.In conclusion, while tourism impacts the environment significantly, simply introducing extra taxes on transport or accommodation is a drastic measure. It could be more valuable to change the methods of transportation to decrease pollution, instead making people stay close to home.
llm: Traveling today is remarkably easy, allowing individuals to journey from Europe to Singapore in just twelve hours, nearly circling the globe. This simplicity has transformed tourism over the years. Where families once took pride in driving two hours to a lake, many now view long-haul trips across the world as routine. However, this shift has a downside, as it contributes to increased pollution. To combat this issue, proposals for additional taxes on flights or accommodations have emerged to raise the cost of tourism and deter excessive travel.Regardless of the mode of transportation, travel generates pollution. Reducing the environmental impact of tourism may require a recalibration of the industry itself. If higher taxes are linked to travel distance, many might opt to vacation closer to home, as even a slight increase in costs could render planned holidays unaffordable. Accommodation taxes would also elevate travel expenses, regardless of distance. Thus, if travel and accommodation taxes were implemented, both tourism and pollution could see a decline.Nevertheless, the primary modes of transport affected by these increased taxes would likely be communal options like planes, trains, and buses, which could inadvertently burden non-tourists as well. Additionally, vacations play a crucial role in people's lives, providing essential relief from work and stress while allowing quality time with loved ones. Restricting travel could significantly diminish some of life's simple joys.In summary, while tourism undoubtedly impacts the environment, imposing additional taxes on transportation and accommodations may be an extreme approach. A more effective solution might involve innovating transportation methods to reduce pollution, rather than simply encouraging people to stay closer to home.

question: Traffic and housing problems could be solved by moving large companies, factories and their employees to the countryside.Do you agree or disagree?
human: Many metropolises are facing challenges, including traffic gams and serious lacking of housing available for families to live, particular in the developed countries. The governments are looking for a way to lessen the volume of traffic in the cities and to increase the number of housing provision over the metropolises. Some people advocate the businesses including large corporations and factories along with their employees moving to the suburbs which is the best way to figure out the metropolitan problems. Is this a sheer solution for these challenges faced by the cities?Economy boom in a country is accompanied with a number of problems incurred in the cities due to the multitudes living in there. It is no wonder that metropolises represent more job opportunities available and better education system to next generations. These are strong pull factors appealing people to stay in the cities despite the higher cost in living. A larger number of populations in the cities not only result in a severe shortage of housing where there is a higher demand of housing over the available supply, but also bring the higher volume of traffic across the cities, particular in a peak hour when a thousand and one employees commuting to work and students going to schools. Some people believe the working location shifting to rural areas is a solution that enables to lessen the frequent usage of roads in cities. Simultaneously, it is assumed that the housing issue can be solved naturally arising from the migration of their employees into the suburban town next to their working place.The business allocated to suburbs alone is rarely considered enough to tackle these problems. A place to live requires the basic facilities to serve for clothing, food, housing and transportation which are basic needs of human. If there is a working place and residential area only in the suburban town without any infrastructures, people have no choice to drive their vehicles back and forth between cities and their living places for the general consumption. As a consequence, the traffic congestion in cities will be worsen combining with the significant deterioration of air quality in the countryside due to an increase in the emission of the greenhouse gases. Therefore, the governments play a key role to establish a neighborhood which could be self-sufficient communities outside of their larger metropolitan areas. This may be a feasible and effective way to minimize the metropolitan issues.My own view is that the shifting strategies in suburbs can help lessen the challenges faced by metropolises. But the governments should take the smart planning into consideration in which the employment bases with the living infrastructures are developed in the suburban town.
llm: Many major cities are grappling with significant challenges, such as traffic congestion and a severe shortage of housing for families, particularly in developed nations. Governments are seeking ways to reduce urban traffic and increase housing availability across these metropolises. Some propose relocating businesses, including large corporations and factories, along with their employees, to suburban areas as a potential solution to urban issues. But is this truly an effective remedy for the problems these cities face?Economic growth in a country often leads to various urban challenges due to the influx of people into cities. It's no surprise that metropolises offer abundant job opportunities and superior educational systems for future generations, which are compelling reasons for individuals to remain despite the high cost of living. This rising population not only exacerbates the housing crisis—where demand far exceeds supply—but also leads to significant traffic congestion, particularly during peak hours when thousands of employees are commuting to work and students are heading to school. Some argue that moving workplaces to rural areas could alleviate congestion on city roads. Additionally, the theory suggests that this migration would naturally address the housing shortage as workers relocate to suburban areas near their jobs.However, simply relocating businesses to the suburbs is unlikely to fully address these issues. Livable areas require essential amenities—such as access to food, clothing, housing, and transportation—to meet basic human needs. If suburban towns only consist of workplace and residential zones without proper infrastructure, residents will have no option but to travel back and forth between the cities and their homes for daily necessities. This would likely worsen urban traffic congestion while also deteriorating air quality in surrounding areas due to increased greenhouse gas emissions. Therefore, governments must play a crucial role in developing self-sufficient communities outside major metropolitan areas. This approach could be a viable and effective means of mitigating the challenges faced by cities.In my opinion, relocating businesses to the suburbs can help alleviate some pressures on metropolises. However, it's essential for governments to engage in smart planning, ensuring that employment centers are developed alongside necessary infrastructure to support living in suburban towns.

question: Universities should accept equal numbers of male and female students in every subject.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: While some people argue that equal numbers of male and female students should be accepted in every major, I personally disagree with this statement.There are a number of arguments that can support my stance. To begin with, it is impossible to enroll equal genders of students in every subject. It is true that some faculties are underrepresented by a particular gender. For example, STEM subjects usually have more male students than females, but the opposite is true in educational-related subjects, which phenomenon seems to violate the principle that we fight endeavor today, gender equality. Therefore, people want to accept equal numbers of students to achieve a gender balance in every subject. However, the reality is that different genders prefer to study different subjects themselves, but not because of the unequal opportunity. According to one of the research, women show a higher interest in subjects like education, psychology and arts rather than science-related subjects. As a result, it is apparent that admitting equivalent proportions of male and female students can hardly be achieved.In addition, it will deprive students of chances to make their own choices if universities enroll both genders equally in every subject mandatorily. It should be noted that it is students' right to select the subjects freely in college. If students cannot register for the subjects they want to study just because there are not enough quotas left for particular gender of students, or they are forced to study some subjects they are not interested in just because they need to fulfill the gender requirement in the class, it will hinder students' learning in the long-run.To conclude, universities should not enroll equal gender students in every subject as it is impossible to achieve and may deprive students the freedom to choose the major they want to study.
llm: While some individuals advocate for equal representation of male and female students in every academic major, I respectfully disagree with this perspective. There are several points that support my position. Firstly, it is unrealistic to aim for equal gender enrollment across all disciplines. Certain fields indeed exhibit gender imbalances; for instance, STEM programs typically attract a higher proportion of male students, while education and arts-related fields tend to have more female participants. This discrepancy, while often viewed as contrary to our pursuit of gender equality, reflects inherent preferences rather than a lack of opportunity. Research indicates that women generally gravitate towards subjects like education, psychology, and the arts, rather than toward science and technology. Consequently, achieving equal representation of male and female students in every major is practically unfeasible.Moreover, enforcing equal recruitment of both genders in every discipline could restrict students' autonomy in choosing their preferred paths. Students should have the right to select their subjects freely during their college experience. If admissions policies prevent students from enrolling in the courses of their choice due to quota limitations based on gender, or compel them to pursue fields where they lack interest to meet gender requirements, it could negatively impact their motivation and learning outcomes over time.In summary, universities should refrain from mandating equal gender enrollment in all subjects, as this goal is unattainable and could compromise students' freedom to choose their desired majors.

question: Universities should allocate the same amount of money to their sport activities as they allocate to their libraries. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Yes, I do feel that universities should have an equal budget for their libraries as well as sport activities. It is our general belief that a good player can not be good student and hence we restrict our children’s sport activities at college level. Moreover, an academic degree has much more value than sport activities which naturally compels students to focus more on their studies than their interest in sport.Most of the universities keep sports at of their priority list, good players do not get enough facilities and to improve their skills and eventually they their interest.Universities can play substantial role in shaping this upcoming talent by providing good trainers and which is otherwise too expensive to afford. Also it will attract other students sports and inculcate importance of physical fitness in them.Universities should produce in all fields rather than only concentrating on progress of scholars. Hence, I feel that universities should allot equal amounts of money to as well as sport activities.
llm: I believe that universities should allocate an equal budget for their libraries and sports activities. There is a common perception that a successful athlete cannot also be a strong student, which leads us to limit college-level sports participation for our children. Additionally, an academic degree is often seen as more valuable than sports, which naturally encourages students to prioritize their studies over athletic pursuits. Many universities place sports low on their list of priorities, resulting in insufficient resources for talented athletes to enhance their skills, ultimately diminishing their interest in sports. By investing in quality trainers—services that are often too costly for individuals to afford—universities can significantly contribute to nurturing emerging talent. This support could also attract more students to engage in sports and promote the importance of physical fitness. Universities should strive to foster excellence across all fields, not just academics. Therefore, I firmly believe that an equal amount of funding should be dedicated to both academic resources and sports activities.

question: We are becoming increasingly dependent on computers. They are used in business, crime detection and even to fly planes. What things will they be used for in future? Is this dependence on computers a good thing or should we be more suspicious of their benefits?
human: Today computers are used almost everywhere, it is impossible to imagine our life without PCs, Internet, mobile phones and other computer devices. It is reasonable to think that people look forward to the future of computers., computers make our life easier, we can easily get information about any product we plan to buy or place we plan to visit in a second using a personal computer and . Scientists predict that in the nearest future it will be possible to smell a new perfume using the Internet and watch 3D scenes at home like we do in the movie theater. According to forecasts of HR agencies machines will replace jobs of cashiers, and civil and military pilots. Some corporations in Japan are already sellinghousewife-robots, which help old people to keep their homes clean.Despite the fact that computers help us, they make us dependent. Apparently, people spend more time behind monitors than ever before. And some of them feel a need for more time to be spent with people in live contact. In addition, a breakdown of one of the important modules of a specific computer can entail serious consequences. to mention the computer problem that occurred in the end of 1990s, a problem related to the coming year 2000 (Y2K) and catastrophes that were predicted. Fortunately imminent disasters did not happen. However, it is difficult to imagine what could if all the predictions came true.We live in a technological era, computers penetrated everywhere with all benefits they provide and all dangers they hide. However we are satisfied with them and sometimes we even thank them because they help us in communicating, studying, doing business, entertaining and saving lives in critical situations.
llm: Today, computers have become ubiquitous, making it nearly impossible to envision our lives without personal computers, the Internet, mobile phones, and various other digital devices. It's only natural to anticipate the future developments in computing. Computers simplify our lives, allowing us to quickly access information about products we're considering buying or places we plan to visit. Scientists predict that soon we may be able to experience the scent of a new perfume online or enjoy 3D movie scenes in the comfort of our homes. According to forecasts from human resources agencies, machines are expected to take over the jobs of cashiers, as well as civil and military pilots. Some Japanese companies have even begun marketing robotic assistants to help elderly individuals maintain a clean household.Despite the advantages computers offer, they also foster dependency. People are spending more time than ever in front of screens, and some are expressing a desire for more face-to-face interactions. Additionally, if a key component of a computer fails, it can lead to significant issues. For example, during the late 1990s, concerns about the Year 2000 (Y2K) bug led to widespread predictions of catastrophe, which ultimately did not materialize. Nonetheless, it's somewhat unsettling to consider what might have occurred if those scenarios had come to fruition.We are living in a technological age where computers are intricately woven into the fabric of daily life, bringing with them both remarkable advantages and hidden dangers. Nevertheless, we remain largely satisfied with these machines, often expressing gratitude for their roles in enhancing communication, education, business, entertainment, and even saving lives in emergencies.

question: We are becoming increasingly dependent on computers. They are used in business, hospitals, crime detection and even to fly planes. What things will they be used for in the future? Is this dependence on computers a good thing or should we be more suspicious of their benefits?
human: In the last two decades cybernetics have experienced a major breakthrough .This led to the utilization of computers in nearly all parts of our daily life, from personal computers to the ones performing complicated surgeries.
